Document-Accept.name: Accept
Document-Accept.description: Adding this header param will instruct the API to return JSON version of the document, otherwise it will return the document in its original document type byte response.

id.description:
ID of an object.

Receipt object signed with hub's private key.

signature.description: Meta object signed with account's private key.

received_at.description: Database insertion date and time in unix (milliseconds) format

token.description: Account's private key encoded with account's password

data.name: Asset view, not from account-5 and whos info event contains tag1 in tag property
Asset view, not from account-5 and whos info event contains tag1 in tag property

attach.name: attach-*
attach.description:
Attaches all events per each asset found, based on this query filter value.
Part of query param key after attach-* represents property database will query against, and value of this query param is the value to match.
Both query param key and value have to be URI encoded values. **Example**: ?attach-object.data.type=info

limit-query.name: limit
limit-query.description: Number of results to return in the response
